article:
Brownie and Spotty were neighbor dogs who met every day to play together. Like pairs of dogs you  _  find in any neighborhood, these two  _  each other and played together so often that they had worn a path through the grass of the field between their own houses.
One evening, Brownie's family  _  that Brownie hadn't returned home. They went looking for him with no  _  Brownie didn't appear the next day, and despite their  _  to find him, by the next week he was still missing. Curiously, Spotty  showed up  at Brownie's house alone, barking. Busy with their own lives, Brownie's family just ignored the  _  little neighbor dog. Finally, one morning Spotty  _  to take "no" for an answer any longer. He followed Ted about, barking strongly, then running towards a nearby wood, as if to say,"  Follow  me! It's urgent!"
Then Ted followed the anxious Spotty. The little dog led the man to a  _  spot a half mile from the house. There Ted found his beloved Brownie  _  but one of his hind legs stuck in a steel leg-hold trap. Horrified, Ted now wished he'd taken Spotty's earlier requirement  _  Then Ted noticed something quite remarkable. Spotty had done more than simply  _  Brownie's owner to his trapped friend. In a circle around the  _  dog, Ted found some dog food, which was later  _  as the remains of every meal Spotty had been fed that  _  !Spotty had been visiting Brownie  _  with Brownie to protect him from being hurt, snuggling with him at night to keep him warm and touching him gently with its nose to keep his  _  up. Brownie's leg was treated by a veterinarian and he recovered. For many years afterward, the two  _  watched the faithful friends frolicking and chasing each other down that well worn path between their houses.
